summary: Adds water pumps outside the five vanilla homes that you can take water from.  Compatible with Realistic Needs and Diseases, Imps More Complex Needs and Drink Eat Sleep Bathe.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][color=#A9BCF5][b][u]UPDATE - Version 1.1[/u]

The original version of the mod was accidentally uploaded without meshes or textures. Please upgrade to the latest version (1.1) and the pump will actually appear. I apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. [/b][/color][/size]

[size=4][color=#A9BCF5][b][u]UPDATE - Vanilla Version 1.2[/u]

Version 1.1 did not include the empty bottle script. Please upgrade to 1.2 and you will now recieve an empty wine bottle after drinking a bottle of water.[/b][/color][/size]



This mod adds a water pump outside of the five original player houses. You can use this pump to fill your empty bottles and waterskins when using 'Realistic Needs and Diseases', 'Imps More Complex Needs' or 'Drink Eat Sleep Bathe'.

[color=#A9BCF5][u][b]Pump Locations[/b][/u]

[list][*][b][u]Breezehome (Whiterun)[/b][/u]
To the left of the front door. Will appear once you have purchased the kitchen upgrade.

[*][b][u]Honeyside (Riften)[/b][/u]
Against the back wall of the garden. Will appear once you have purchased the kitchen upgrade.

[*][b][u]Proudspire Manor (Solitude)[/b][/u]
Under the arch, to the left of the front door. Will appear once you have purchased the kitchen upgrade.

[*][b][u]Hjerim (Windhelm)[/b][/u]
To the right of the front door. Will appear once you have purchased the kitchen upgrade.

[*][b][u]Vlindrel Hall (Markarth)[/b][/u]
Just outside the front door. Will appear once you have purchased the living room upgrade.[/list][/color]

[color=orange][u][b]Versions[/b][/u]

[list][*][u]RND Version[/u]
Items are filled in this order when you use the pump...

Empty waterskins --> Large empty bottles --> Medium empty bottles --> Small empty bottles.[/list]


[list][*][u]IMCN Version[/u]
Items are filled in this order when you use the pump...

Empty waterskins --> Quarter-full waterskins --> Half-full water skins --> Three quarter-full waterskins --> Large empty wine bottles --> Large empty wine bottles (with basket) --> Small empty wine bottles --> Small empty wine bottles (with basket) --> Empty spiced wine bottles.[/list]


[list][*][u]Drink Eat Sleep Bathe Version[/u]
Using a pump will fill an empty water bottle with spring water.[/list]


[list][*][u]Vanilla Version[/u]
Does not require any other mods. You will need an empty wine bottle in your inventory to use the pump.

Items are filled in this order when you use the pump...

Large empty wine bottles --> Large empty wine bottles (with basket) --> Small empty wine bottles --> Small empty wine bottles (with basket) --> Empty spiced wine bottles.

Drinking a bottle of water will add an empty wine bottle to your inventory. Water restores 15 stamina over 5 seconds and fortifies stamina by 10 points for 5 minutes. [/list][/color]


[b][u]Acknowledgements[/u][/b]

Water pump model created by 'Runspect'.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26132/?]Resource for modders[/url]

This is an excellent collection of modders resources.
author: Thicketford
